# Draft:Historical Site of 73662 Homestead Drive â€“ Twentynine Palms, California

73662 Homestead Drive
73662 Homestead Drive is a commercial property located in Twentynine Palms, California, in San Bernardino County. Built in 1958, the building reflects Santa Fe architectural influences and has been adapted over time to serve multiple community and commercial uses. It is currently the home of Rasta Rita Cantina & Venue, a rustic indoor-outdoor event space that contributes to the growing wedding and event scene in the High Desert region near Joshua Tree National Park.12
Historical Use
Since the late 1950s, the property has supported a variety of uses, reflecting the changing needs of the Twentynine Palms area. Past tenants and uses have included a U.S. government support services office, a Western antique store, an art gallery, a thrift shop, and general administrative offices.1 Its flexible footprint has allowed for seamless adaptation to diverse business and cultural functions.
Property Features
The primary structure spans approximately 1,320 square feet, featuring:
A large open interior
A kitchenette and half bathroom
A workshop with a 14-by-6-foot roll-up door
The property also includes:
A 2,640-square-foot concrete slab located behind the main building
A 448-square-foot studio apartment with a private kitchen and bath
An enclosed courtyard, suitable for gatherings or private functions
On-site parking, situated across a 0.53-acre lot1
These features support a variety of uses, from mixed residential-commercial occupancy to full-scale event hosting.
Current Use: Rasta Rita Cantina & Venue
The property is currently home to Rasta Rita Cantina & Venue, a private event space operated by the team behind Rasta Taco and Rasta Rita Margarita Trucks. The site blends adobe-style architecture with rustic and mission-style details, including a bell tower, courtyard, and flexible event staging areas. Originally a service station, the building later functioned as a military commissary and art gallery before its transformation into a cantina and venue space in 2020. It now regularly hosts weddings, military events, and government functions.3
Regional Context
Twentynine Palms is the northern gateway to Joshua Tree National Park and home to the Marine Corps Air Ground Combat Center (MCAGCC). Officially incorporated in 1987, the city maintains Indigenous cultural ties and is recognized for its public mural program.2
According to a 2025 Los Angeles Times article, the surrounding Joshua Tree region has become a sought-after location for nontraditional weddings and private retreats, particularly appealing to couples from Los Angeles seeking a nature-connected experience. Venues like Rasta Rita Cantina are noted for offering intimate settings for under 100 guests.2
